title: Node missing attestations for a few months now, trying to investigate root cause
body:
# üêû Bug Report

### Description

Hey guys, I've been having an issue with my node for a few months now
Every now and then I'm missing attestations and I've been looking into why

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2350015/142082524-893238a7-7632-4834-8d52-a0ae798b1eea.png)

As you can see in the screenshot above, every few days I'm missing attestations.

When I check out the Validator logs I can see the error why it missed it:

```
Nov 11 18:30:48 ************* validator[*************]: time="2021-11-11 18:30:48" level=info msg="Attestation schedule" attesterDutiesAtSlot=1 prefix=validator pubKeys=[*************] slot=************* slotInEpoch=25 totalAttestersInEpoch=1
Nov 11 18:36:17 ************* validator[*************]: time="2021-11-11 18:36:17" level=error msg="Could not request attestation to sign at slot" error="rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded" prefix=validator pubKey=************* slot=*************
```

Apparently the DeadlineExceeded.

Checking the BeaconChain logs reveals a period of innactivity of about 2 minutes:

```
Nov 11 18:34:40 =******** beacon-chain[=********]: time="2021-11-11 18:34:40" level=info msg="Synced new block" block==********... epoch==******** finalizedEpoch==******** finalizedRoot==********... parentRoot==********... prefix=blockchain slot==******** slotInEpoch=*** version=altair
Nov 11 18:34:40 =******** beacon-chain[=********]: time="2021-11-11 18:34:40" level=info msg="Finished applying state transition" attestations=99 prefix=blockchain slot=******** syncBitsCount=505
Nov 11 18:34:43 =******** beacon-chain[=********]: time="2021-11-11 18:34:43" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=72 inbound=55 outbound=17 prefix=p2p

2 minutes of no action here

Nov 11 18:36:17 =******** beacon-chain[=********]: time="2021-11-11 18:36:17" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=71 inbound=55 outbound=17 prefix=p2p
Nov 11 18:36:34 =******** beacon-chain[=********]: time="2021-11-11 18:36:34" level=info msg="Synced new block" block==********... epoch==******** finalizedEpoch==******** finalizedRoot==********... parentRoot==********... prefix=blockchain slot==******** slotInEpoch=*** version=altair
```

When I check out Grafana I can indeed see something happening at that time:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2350015/142082671-34a4a921-c713-4543-a9c2-e29ca537fc6c.png)

If I zoom into that:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2350015/142082728-5ef6f18a-2d4e-4000-8acf-6d1cf30a4501.png)

You can see that at the time the attestation was missed there's a period of about 2 minutes with "No Data"
The Geth log is also interesting:

```
Nov 11 18:34:14 Unindexed transactions                   blocks=1  txs=243  tail=*******elapsed=2.822ms
Nov 11 18:34:26 Imported new chain segment               blocks=1  txs=422  mgas=*******elapsed=903.182ms   mgasps=28.292  number=****** hash=******* dirty=511.83MiB
Nov 11 18:34:26 Unindexed transactions                   blocks=1  txs=184  tail=*******elapsed=16.453ms
Nov 11 18:34:35 Imported new chain segment               blocks=1  txs=89   mgas=*******elapsed=240.253ms   mgasps=23.642  number=****** hash=******* dirty=509.74MiB
Nov 11 18:34:35 Unindexed transactions                   blocks=1  txs=222  tail=*******elapsed=3.190ms
Nov 11 18:36:17 Deep froze chain segment                 blocks=3  elapsed=1m23.486s   number=******* hash=*******
Nov 11 18:36:17 Imported new chain segment               blocks=1  txs=178  mgas=******  elapsed=457.927ms   mgasps=30.155  number=****** hash=******* age=1m43s    dirty=509.67MiB
Nov 11 18:36:17 Unindexed transactions                   blocks=1  txs=109  tail=****** elapsed=1.914ms
Nov 11 18:36:55 Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=****** err=timeout
Nov 11 18:37:01 Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=****** err=timeout
Nov 11 18:37:07 Imported new chain segment               blocks=1  txs=266  mgas=******  elapsed=48.592s     mgasps=0.423   number=****** hash=******* age=2m22s    dirty=509.16MiB
Nov 11 18:37:07 Unindexed transactions                   blocks=1  txs=245  tail=******elapsed=4.214ms
Nov 11 18:37:08 Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=****** err=timeout
Nov 11 18:37:19 Deep froze chain segment                 blocks=2  elapsed=2.017s      number=******* hash=*******
Nov 11 18:37:25 Imported new chain segment               blocks=1  txs=148  mgas=****** elapsed=17.880s     mgasps=0.709   number=****** hash=******* age=2m26s    dirty=508.14MiB
Nov 11 18:37:37 Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=****** err=timeout
```

The things I find peculiar:
1. Quite some dropping of peers
2. Deep Froze chain segment taking more then a minute
3. Imported new chain segment taking 50 seconds and 18 seconds

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

Nope

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

I followed this guide without any issues about a year ago:
https://someresat.medium.com/guide-to-staking-on-ethereum-2-0-ubuntu-prysm-56f681646f74

## üî• Error

```
Could not request attestation to sign at slot" error="rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded
```

## üåç  Your Environment

**Operating System:** Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**

I last updated my system on: 2021-10-25, so the version that was actual then.

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

N/A

Hey @devedse , 

Could you confirm if this is still relevant with `v2.0.4` ?

I haven't updated to the latest version yet, I'll do that now. I did see I missed about 4 attestations again on the 28th of November.

This is some information about the one at 03:09:
The log messages look a bit different then the ones in the initial issue. Here's the relevant ones (I think):

Geth:
```
INFO [11-28|03:00:47.963] Unindexed transactions                   blocks=1  txs=140  tail=11,349,868 elapsed=2.733ms
WARN [11-28|03:02:12.991] Head headers broke chain ordering        peer=blahblahpeer1 index=0 requested=13,699,866 received=13,699,868
WARN [11-28|03:02:12.991] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=blahblahpeer1 err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: head headers broke chain ordering"
ERROR[11-28|03:02:13.594] Snapshot extension registration failed   peer=blahblahsomeotherpeer err="peer connected on snap without compatible eth support"
```

Beacon:
```
Shows nothing strange, just "Synced new block" and "Finished applying state transition"
```


Validator:
```
time="2021-11-28 02:56:23" level=info msg="Attestation schedule" attesterDutiesAtSlot=1 prefix=validator pubKeys=[******] slot=2603703 slotInEpoch=23 totalAttestersInEpoch=1
time="2021-11-28 03:01:11" level=error msg="Could not request attestation to sign at slot" error="rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded" prefix=validator pubKey=******* slot=2603703
```


I also ran a permanent ping to see if anything would happen with network connectivity, but this was all perfectly fine during the missed attestations:

Command:
```
nohup ping 8.8.8.8 | while read pong; do echo "$(date): $pong"; done | tee /home/admin/pingoutput.txt &
```

Output:
```
Sun 28 Nov 2021 03:01:33 PM UTC: 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=23211 ttl=120 time=3.89 ms
Sun 28 Nov 2021 03:01:34 PM UTC: 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=23212 ttl=120 time=3.95 ms
Sun 28 Nov 2021 03:01:35 PM UTC: 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=23213 ttl=120 time=3.92 ms
Sun 28 Nov 2021 03:01:36 PM UTC: 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=23214 ttl=120 time=4.01 ms
Sun 28 Nov 2021 03:01:37 PM UTC: 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=23215 ttl=120 time=3.94 ms
Sun 28 Nov 2021 03:01:38 PM UTC: 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=23216 ttl=120 time=3.95 ms
Sun 28 Nov 2021 03:01:39 PM UTC: 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=23217 ttl=120 time=3.92 ms
```

This is an interesting log from geth:
```
WARN [11-28|03:02:12.991] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=blahblahpeer1 err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: head headers broke chain ordering"
```
Potentially it might be geth re-creating state which might have led to a spike in CPU usage at that particular moment. Although without more data it is hard to know. Let me know if you still encounter this in v2.0.4 and what the resource consumption is around that time.

I just checked and tonight I had 3 more missed attestations at 03:23, 03:40 and 03:51.

I do see some spikes in resource usage too around this time:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2350015/144209494-67019aca-ac5a-4ac9-a6bf-bcea4db3c5a6.png)

@nisdas I'm also experiencing this issue for over 5 months now (using various versions of Prysm).
It's not that bad as I might miss around 10 attestations a day, but I'd prefer to not miss any. Just today I already missed 9

Here are some logs from my validator:

```
[2023-04-09 15:50:47]  INFO validator: Attestation schedule attesterDutiesAtSlot=1 pubKeys=[redacted] slot=6185953 slotInEpoch=1 timeTillDuty=12s totalAttestersInEpoch=1
[2023-04-09 15:50:48]  INFO validator: Submitted builder validator registration settings for custom builders
[2023-04-09 15:51:11] ERROR validator: Could not submit attestation to beacon node error=rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded pubKey=[redacted] slot=6185953
.....
[2023-04-09 19:34:47]  INFO validator: Attestation schedule attesterDutiesAtSlot=1 pubKeys=[redacted] slot=6187072 slotInEpoch=0 totalAttestersInEpoch=1
[2023-04-09 19:34:48]  INFO validator: Submitted builder validator registration settings for custom builders
[2023-04-09 19:34:59] ERROR validator: Could not request attestation to sign at slot error=rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded pubKey=[redacted] slot=6187072
...
[2023-04-09 20:45:11]  INFO validator: Attestation schedule attesterDutiesAtSlot=1 pubKeys=[redacted] slot=6187424 slotInEpoch=0 totalAttestersInEpoch=1
[2023-04-09 20:45:12]  INFO validator: Submitted builder validator registration settings for custom builders
[2023-04-09 20:45:23] ERROR validator: Could not request attestation to sign at slot error=rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded pubKey=[redacted] slot=6187424

```

As you can see, all of these missed attestations are from today.

This is unusual @sdalmeida 
```
[2023-04-09 15:51:11] ERROR validator: Could not submit attestation to beacon node error=rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded pubKey=[redacted] slot=6185953
```
The main reason for such errors is that the beacon node is very stressed, so it can't submit these attestations in time. Any errors in your beacon node ?

@nisdas interesting, I added the `[--verbosity=debug](https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/parameters#beacon-node-flags)` flag to my beacon node and these are the logs from when my validator missed an attestation:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103528/231023254-23767be4-af09-4e45-9495-c49564f7208e.png)

```
[2023-04-10 16:03:26] DEBUG blockchain: Synced new payload blockHash=0x4ab6ff461f56 gasUtilized=0.39 parentHash=0x4ab3c87bdb17
[2023-04-10 16:03:26]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=128 payloadHash=0x4ab6ff461f56 slot=6193215 syncBitsCount=504 txCount=131
[2023-04-10 16:03:27] DEBUG sync: Verified and saved pending attestations to pool blockRoot=2f919dc02430 pendingAttsCount=1
[2023-04-10 16:03:35] DEBUG powchain: Latest eth1 chain event blockHash=0x4ab6ff461f5633eec8a300fae57099c491a78de005b92733c48238f27486244a blockNumber=17018846
[2023-04-10 16:03:38] DEBUG sync: Received block blockSlot=6193216 graffiti=huobipool proposerIndex=219123 sinceSlotStartTime=2.936792131s
[2023-04-10 16:03:38] DEBUG sync: Gossip message was ignored agent=nimbus error=sync message time 2023-04-10 16:01:59 +0000 UTC (slot 6193208) not within allowable range of 2023-04-10 16:03:35 +0000 UTC (slot 6193216) to 2023-04-10 16:03:39.164187226 +0000 UTC m=+2200.273544541 (slot 6193216) gossip score=0.053005281871610924 multiaddress=/ip4/135.181.60.170/tcp/9000 peer id=16Uiu2HAkycVuNHcLqgaVi8MXquwoi6c9Qrxx6PrtTAjDmZANtA3H topic=/eth2/4a26c58b/sync_committee_contribution_and_proof/ssz_snappy
[2023-04-10 16:03:49] DEBUG powchain: Latest eth1 chain event blockHash=0x200352b20ca35d1262fce11df7fdc023c2311f38feba6440d240df92217e3c14 blockNumber=17018847
[2023-04-10 16:03:55] DEBUG blockchain: Synced new block block=0xa6a11016... chainServiceProcessedTime=16.620549558s deposits=0 epoch=193538 finalizedEpoch=193536 finalizedRoot=0xe771ef47... justifiedEpoch=193537 justifiedRoot=0x8f432ec6... parentRoot=0x2f919dc0... sinceSlotStartTime=20.085744369s slot=6193216 slotInEpoch=0 version=bellatrix
[2023-04-10 16:03:55] DEBUG blockchain: Synced new payload blockHash=0x200352b20ca3 gasUtilized=0.42 parentHash=0x4ab6ff461f56
[2023-04-10 16:03:55]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=128 payloadHash=0x200352b20ca3 slot=6193216 syncBitsCount=504 txCount=180
[2023-04-10 16:03:55] DEBUG sync: Verified and saved pending attestations to pool blockRoot=a6a11016c62f pendingAttsCount=1
[2023-04-10 16:03:55] DEBUG sync: Requesting block for pending attestation attCount=35 attSlot=6193217 blockRoot=9903289905f1 currentSlot=6193217
[2023-04-10 16:03:55] DEBUG sync: Received block blockSlot=6193217 graffiti=Twinstake proposerIndex=477073 sinceSlotStartTime=1.012381639s
[2023-04-10 16:03:57] DEBUG blockchain: Synced new block block=0x99032899... chainServiceProcessedTime=2.205955918s deposits=0 epoch=193538 finalizedEpoch=193536 finalizedRoot=0xe771ef47... justifiedEpoch=193537 justifiedRoot=0x8f432ec6... parentRoot=0xa6a11016... sinceSlotStartTime=10.348059968s slot=6193217 slotInEpoch=1 version=bellatrix
[2023-04-10 16:03:57] DEBUG blockchain: Synced new payload blockHash=0x6bad1f233123 gasUtilized=0.81 parentHash=0x200352b20ca3
[2023-04-10 16:03:57]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=128 payloadHash=0x6bad1f233123 slot=6193217 syncBitsCount=419 txCount=197
[2023-04-10 16:04:00] DEBUG sync: Could not send recent block request error=i/o deadline exceeded
[2023-04-10 16:04:00] DEBUG sync: Received block blockSlot=6193218 graffiti= proposerIndex=123427 sinceSlotStartTime=955.387863ms
[2023-04-10 16:04:02] DEBUG blockchain: Synced new block block=0x4d3d0be9... chainServiceProcessedTime=2.671383997s deposits=0 epoch=193538 finalizedEpoch=193536 finalizedRoot=0xe771ef47... justifiedEpoch=193537 justifiedRoot=0x8f432ec6... parentRoot=0x99032899... sinceSlotStartTime=3.958762654s slot=6193218 slotInEpoch=2 version=bellatrix
```

The message that really got my attention was the following:

```
[2023-04-10 16:04:00] DEBUG sync: Could not send recent block request error=i/o deadline exceeded
```

My Beacon and Validator node is not running on an SSD (only Geth). I have 4x 4TB running zRaid2.
Looking at the I/O usage during that time, it peaked at just 10 IOps. Should my Beacon node be on an SSD like Geth?

Ah this is pretty interesting @sdalmeida , do you mind telling us what is the size of your validator db ? I suspect, it takes an
excessive amount of time for the validator to write to its db, which causes a much longer than expected attestation broadcast time.

Its possible that both the validator process and beacon process are trying to write to the db at the same time. The disk being a HDD takes a longer time to handle this which explains the occasional deadlines that you do see. I suspect if your reduce the size of your beacon db, your performance should be back to normal:
https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/checkpoint-sync

Of course, if you want to maintain the same db, you can then try upgrading to a ssd

@nisdas I can confirm that after switching to an SSD, I haven't missed a single attestation yet! Thanks for your help!

@devedse can you confirm if you're still experiencing this issue?
Closing as a hardware upgrade seemed to resolve. please reopen if not the case.

Hi all
Running two validators on the same machine, each one misses around 1-3 attestations a day.
`Previous epoch voting summary" correctlyVotedHead=false correctlyVotedSource=false correctlyVotedTarget=false...`
Can't figure out why.

Running Prysm and Erigon. Similar issues to the ones noted in this thread.
Im pretty sure it started around release of 4.0.0.

The only error that shows up for me is a past deposit contract log on the beacon-chain which shows up every minute or so.
` level=error msg="Unable to process past deposit contract logs, perhaps your execution client is not fully synced" error="processPastLogs: Could not process deposit log: received incorrect merkle index: wanted 409932 but got 452448" prefix=powchain`

Not sure if this is an Erigon problem not providing the correct information or a Prysm problem.

Any advice would be great :)
